Could you say what you were doing when you saw this exception? Were you editing an aspect? class? Were there compilation errors at the time? 

I recently fixed a BCException which occured on the same line - BcelWeaver.java:1095 (see bug 119882), plus there have been changes put in recently which means that if changes have been made to an aspect then we go back to the source and do a full build. The problem you're seeing is occuring on an incremental build. If you could describe what you were doing when you saw this bug then we could tell whether these changes are likely to have fixed your problem. Are you able to upgrade your aspectj to the latest development build which includes these changes?
Just as a note, if you're using AJDT then the aspectj version within this hasn't been updated yet to include the fixes I mentioned in comment #2.

I have the last update 1.3.1.20060214104738.
This exception raises when I save a java file.
It 's a minor error for me.
I think as Helen says, the problem is that the AspectJ fix is not available in AJDT yet - we will sort that out early next week.

(In reply to comment #5)
> I think as Helen says, the problem is that the AspectJ fix is not available in
> AJDT yet - we will sort that out early next week.

Hi, Just checking to see if this is fixed in AJDT yet. I get this error everytime I build as well.
we still haven't upgraded AJDT with the fix - my previous comment was a bit hasty as we have been having problems upgrading it.
Just to let you know, the latest AJDT 1.3.1.20060309111525 (for Eclipse 3.1) contains the updated AspectJ which has the fix you're looking for.
Closing this bug as the fix mentioned in previous comments is now available in the latest dev build for AJDT 1.3 and will be in the next dev build for AJDT 1.4.
